properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: An early season snowfall is expected. Locations: portions of central and northern Labrador. Snowfall amount: generally 5 to 10 cm with higher amounts likely inland and over higher terrain. Time span: tonight through Friday night. Remarks: The first accumulating snow of the season is expected to arrive tonight, with the highest amounts expected over higher terrain. Precipitation will change to, or mix with, snow tonight. Surfaces such as highways, roads, and walkways may become difficult to navigate. Motorists should be prepared for winter driving conditions. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-10-09T18:17:35-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-09T02:18:35-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0432269077.2020
Area: Postville - Makkovik, Hopedale and vicinity, Nain and vicinity, Eagle River
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Locations: Churchill Falls and vicinity, Churchill Valley, and Upper Lake Melville. Time span: tonight and Friday. Remarks: Rain has already changed to snow over Churchill Falls and Churchill Valley. Rain is expected to change to snow tonight over Upper Lake Melville. The highest snowfall amounts are expected to be over higher terrain. Lower elevations are expected to receive 10 to 15 cm of snow while higher elevations receive 15 to 30 cm. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-10-09T18:14:43-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-09T02:15:43-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1618685643.2020
Area: Upper Lake Melville, Churchill Valley, Churchill Falls and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Alberta Emergency Alert - Wildfire Alert Updated
properties.Summary:
Description: The wildfire continues to be a risk to the public. People in the area should stay aware of the evolving situation and be able to evacuate on short notice. ### Go to https://511.alberta.ca/List/Alerts for up to date Road Report information. Go to https://wildfire.alberta.ca/ or the M D’s website at https://www.mdbighorn.ca/AlertCenter.aspx?AID=Notice-of-Wildfire-14 for current information.
Expires: 2020-10-15T09:58:09-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Municipal District of Bighorn No. 8, 2020-10-08T09:56:43-06:00, NAADS-CA-AB-AEA1-6613
Area: Bighorn #8
properties.Author: Municipal District of Bighorn No. 8

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant snowfall expected over higher terrain. Locations: Upper Lake Melville and Eagle River Time span: continuing until this evening. Remarks: A mixture of snow and rain is expected to change mostly to snow this morning. The snow is generally expected to remain wet giving only 5 cm over lower elevation areas. However, over higher terrain where temperatures are cooler, up to 15 cm of snow is possible by this evening with potential for poor visibility in blowing snow over exposed areas. Anyone driving the Trans-Labrador Highway should be prepared for highly variable winter driving conditions, especially in the areas closer to Upper Lake Melville. Snow is expected to taper off to flurries this evening. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-10-10T00:08:08-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-09T08:17:08-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0617336768.2020
Area: Upper Lake Melville, Eagle River
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. A moist Pacific frontal system will approach the south coast on Friday bringing heavy rain to West Vancouver Island. The heavy rain will begin early Friday morning and continue through Friday night. Rainfall amounts of 100 to 120 mm are expected by Saturday morning. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-09T14:42:01-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-08T22:43:01-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0422190053.2020
Area: West Vancouver Island
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Some plants may be damaged or even destroyed by frost. Patchy frost is expected tonight and into early Friday morning. Low temperatures are forecast to drop to near or just below the freezing mark. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage frost-sensitive fruit trees and vegetable plants. Temperatures will fall slightly below the freezing mark in these areas tonight. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Possible accumulating snow over higher terrain today and tonight. Location: west coast of Newfoundland. Time span: today and tonight. Remarks: Rain will taper off to showers and flurries today which will persist through tonight. While showers are generally expected along the coast, flurries inland and over higher terrain will accumulate between 5 and 15 cm of snow by Saturday morning. Rain is again expected on Saturday night associated with another system moving in from the west. However, it seems less likely that it will be significant enough to cause any warnings. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-10-09T23:49:19-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-09T07:50:19-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2374298307.2020
Area: Corner Brook and vicinity, Gros Morne, Bay St. George, Parson's Pond - Hawke's Bay, Port Saunders and the Straits
